DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit level
        Off [0]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Speed [SS]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 0 to 5 Unit level
            Off [0]
    Enable Oscillation [EO]
    Disable Oscillation [DO]
    Set Timer [ST]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Speed [SS]
    Enable Oscillation [EO]
    Disable Oscillation [DO]
    Set Timer [ST]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the ceiling fan and set it to speed level 3 with oscillation enabled for 45 minutes?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the request based on the device structure. The user wants to turn on the fan, set speed to level 3, enable oscillation, and set a timer for 45 minutes.

The commands are:
- Turn On [DON] (no parameters)
- Set Speed [SS] with parameter 3 (within 0-5 range)
- Enable Oscillation [EO] (no parameters)
- Set Timer [ST] with parameter 45 (within 0-120 minutes)

All requested parameters are within the allowed ranges and enums.

Result: Execute Turn On, then Set Speed to 3, Enable Oscillation, and Set Timer to 45 minutes.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Advanced Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 20 to 80 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Consumption
      Range 0 to 500 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Report Temperature [RT]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the water heater to 65 degrees Celsius and turn it on. What commands should I use?

The user wants to set the target temperature to 65 °C and turn the water heater on.

From the device structure, the target temperature range is 30 to 75 °C, so 65 °C is valid.

Commands to use:
- Set Target Temperature [STT] with parameter 65
- Turn On [DON]

Therefore, first send Set Target Temperature with 65 °C, then send Turn On command.

Result: Execute Set Target Temperature(65 °C) and Turn On.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Fully Closed [0]
        Fully Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open [OPEN]
    Close [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SP]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt [ST]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Stop [STOP]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Open [OPEN]
    Close [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SP]
    Set Tilt [ST]
    Stop [STOP]

USER QUERY:
Could you close the blinds halfway and tilt them to 30 degrees upwards?

The user wants to close the blinds halfway and tilt them 30 degrees upwards.

From the device structure:
- Position ranges from 0% (fully closed) to 100% (fully open). Halfway closed means position 50%.
- Tilt angle ranges from -90 to 90 degrees. Positive 30 degrees is upwards tilt.

Commands to use:
- Set Position [SP] with parameter 50
- Set Tilt [ST] with parameter 30

Both parameters are within valid ranges.

Result: Send Set Position(50%) and Set Tilt(30 degrees) commands to adjust the blinds accordingly.

***Device***
Name: Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***

      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [SZ]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 1 to 6 Unit zone_number
    Stop Zone [PZ]
        Parameter 1: []

    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Start Zone [SZ]
    Stop Zone [PZ]

USER QUERY:
Please start irrigation in zone 4 with a flow rate of 15 liters per minute and enable the schedule.

The user wants to start irrigation in zone 4, set flow rate to 15 liters per minute, and enable the schedule.

From the device structure:
- Zone number 4 is valid (range 1 to 6).
- Flow rate 15 liters/min is within 0 to 20 liters/min.
- Schedule can be enabled with Enable Schedule [ES].

Commands to send:
- Start Zone [SZ] with parameter 4
- Set Flow Rate [SFR] with parameter 15
- Enable Schedule [ES]

Result: Execute Start Zone(4), Set Flow Rate(15 liters/min), and Enable Schedule commands.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently locked and closed?

The user wants to know if the garage door is locked and closed.

From the device structure, the Door Status can be Closed [0] or Open [1], etc., and Lock Status can be Locked [0] or Unlocked [1].

To answer, the assistant would query the current Door Status and Lock Status.

If Door Status is Closed [0] and Lock Status is Locked [0], then the answer is yes.

Result: Check Door Status and Lock Status; if both are Closed and Locked, respond that the garage door is currently locked and closed; otherwise, provide the current states.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Can you set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and switch to Eco mode?

The user wants to set the refrigerator temperature to 4 °C and change power mode to Eco.

From the device structure:
- Temperature range is 1 to 10 °C, so 4 °C is valid.
- Power modes include Normal [0], Eco [1], and Vacation [2]. Eco mode is valid.

Commands to send:
- Set Temperature [ST] with parameter 4
- Set Power Mode [SPM] with parameter Eco [1]

Result: Execute Set Temperature(4 °C) and Set Power Mode(Eco) commands.
